page.title: 05A GARDEN IN CARDINGTON
page.content: When the Old Vicarage was sold by the Church Authorities in 1970,the new owner took over a solid stone house with 2+ acres of derelict garden. 2 years clearing was needed to start the evolution of a new garden,designed specifically for one- man maintenance. This has meant concentrating on trees, shrubs,roses,alpines and waterside plants with fairly extensive areas of grass. The garden has provided a suitable venue for village events,particularly Church Fetes,and for other fund- raising activities such as the Council for the Protection of Rural England. The garden is also opened twice a year for the National Garden Scheme Charities. It has given pleasure to many people.
